docs.lead_paragraph: A controversial bill to allow physician-assisted suicide for terminally ill patients in California passed a key legislative committee on Tuesday, after failing in the legislature earlier this summer amid opposition from the Catholic Church.

headline.main: California Assisted Suicide Bill Advances in Special Session
headline.print_headline: California Assisted Suicide Bill Advances in Special Session

docs.snippet: A controversial bill to allow physician-assisted suicide for terminally ill patients in California passed a key legislative committee on Tuesday, after failing in the legislature earlier this summer amid opposition from the Catholic Church.

docs.lead_paragraph: Patients and doctors discuss the uncertainties about whether D.C.I.S. will lead to cancer and whether to treat it.

headline.main: Facing Choices About D.C.I.S. After Breast Screenings

docs.snippet: Patients and doctors discuss the uncertainties about whether D.C.I.S. will lead to cancer and whether to treat it.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal court ruled in favor of March for Life, a secular nonprofit that argued religious-only exemptions to employer insurance requirements violated equal protection principles.

headline.main: Judge Allows Moral, Not Just Religious, Contraception Exemptions
headline.print_headline: Judge Grants Moral Basis to Exempt Birth Control

docs.abstract: United States District Court Judge Richard J Leon rules employers do not need to give insurance coverage for contraception even if their objections are moral rather than religious; case involves group March for Life and turns on key aspect of the Affordable Care Act mandating contraception coverage.
docs.snippet: A federal court ruled in favor of March for Life, a secular nonprofit that argued religious-only exemptions to employer insurance requirements violated equal protection principles.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Numerous state regulations aren’t the main reason insurance markets tend to be uncompetitive.

headline.main: The Problem With G.O.P. Plans to Sell Health Insurance Across State Lines
headline.print_headline: The Problem With Selling Health Insurance Nationwide

docs.abstract: The Upshot; proposals to allow sales of private health insurance policies across state lines, idea championed by many Republican presidential candidates, are complicated by local concerns; critics point to differences in health service prices across states and the need to set up local networks of providers, a difficult task.
docs.snippet: Numerous state regulations aren’t the main reason insurance markets tend to be uncompetitive.
